instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW: What is PM_BATLOW? PM_BATLOW is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No battery
threads.message:
Board powers on and boots fine with charger, known good batteries display 0%, dies, and it does not charge. 

Corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C1204</CAPACITOR>, and <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> area
 
I tested the continuity on <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> and all the connections seem to be fine still

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No battery
threads.message:
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, w/ and w/o battery connected.
Also check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>:
           8.62 V - Just Charger
           1.8 V and dropping steadily - Just battery
           5.99V - Bat & Charger

I'm sorry but I couldn't find the SCL and SDA lines related to the battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No battery
threads.message:
Looks like battery is charging.
Let it connected more time and voltage should increase more than 6-7V ("5.9V ( Rising)").

"I'm sorry but I couldn't find the SCL and SDA lines related to the battery"
No idea, looking at battery conector in schematic???
These values should be good, as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is correctly controlled.

There should be bad battery, or broken connector.
